page.title: 13Nether Stowey: Traditions
page.content: Each year on the nearest Saturday to Midsummer's Day,the women and girls of Nether Stowey process through the village, carrying flower posies. A standard bearer, carrying the flag of the Nether Stowey Female Friendly Society, founded in 1859, leads the walkers. Music is provided by the Watchet Town Band. The Society was one of the first in the country, raising money by subscription and contribution to provide a decent burial for members and medical care for the sick. In 1974 its name was changed to The Women's Walk. Its only function now is this traditional procession, finishing with a church service. The Village Carnival, traditionally held in the Autumn but discontinued, was revived with the Queen's Jubilee Celebrations.Now held in May, it is a popular event and attracts tourists.
